title: The lamentation of Edward Bruton, and James Riley, who for the bloody murder committed on the bodies of Henry Howell, and his wife, vpon Queenes Downe, were executed and hanged in chaines, neere the same place on the 18. day of March. 1633. To the tune of, Fortune my foe.
author: Bruton, Edward, d. 1633.
notes: Verse: "Kind countreymen and our acquaintance all ..."

In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcut at head of second. Part 2 has title: Another bloody murder committed neare Ware, in Hartfordshire, by some notorious offenders, who were executed in the same moneth
